text: For our dev workflow, we always want to work on a sandbox portal before deploying to a production portal. We work through local development, so syncing modules and templates isn’t the problem. It would be great tho, if we could export pages from a production portal and import those in a sandbox portal, that way, we can keep our portal up to date and do not have to recreate the pages manually. Is this possible?

Hi everyone,
I need help. Does anyone have the solution to this issue <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/PDF-generation-from-quote-template-page-break/td-p/374264?hubs_source=GCS-community>?
Thanks.
and another question for the world -
does anyone send triggered emails from their test account / portals?

are blog posts on the `/blog/all` limited to 199 posts? i’m not seeing any posts beyond 199 posts. that goes for the two different blogs i’ve checked. i don’t have anything in the for loop to limit the posts.

Per HubSpot support, there is a limit to 200 posts/page. There is no workaround at this time, however they’re looking at upping that number. I tried pagination to see, but no luck. :thumbsdown::skin-tone-3:
Yeah, 90 day portal or a sandbox portal

When we sync our stylesheet through the CLI to a portal, we get a 404 response. This is only when we make changes locally and sync to the portal. It somehow resets the URL. When we use the ‘Preview with display options’, everything seems to work just fine.
This is also when we make changes directly to the main.css in the design manager, so this issue is not related to the CLI.

This issue happens on multiple templates, so if we update our stylesheet, the path to the stylesheet returns a 404. If we change the template for the page / blog, it is fixed temporarily until we update the stylesheet again.
